summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1580: Shiftry (Next Destinies)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1580: Shiftry (Next Destinies)
body:
Shiftry had one of the strangest stories you’ll ever hear for a card in the TCG. It wasn’t very impressive in its time in the Standard format since it was a Stage 2 that also required a coin flip to use its one-time Ability. That made it really hard to use. Then they came up with the Expanded Format, and eventually Forest of Giant Plants was released. That, along with using a Grass-type Nuzleaf, let you keep evolving and devolving Shiftry to try to clear out the opponent’s side before they could do anything. This strategy was still based on luck but could just win on turn 1. Does that sound overpowered? I don’t blame you for saying yes to that, and it ended up in one of the more odd set of decisions when it came to a card being legal in a format.

Shiftry’s 130 HP was standard on a Stage 2. It was just high enough to take some of those bigger attacks that didn’t have a boost behind them in the HGSS-On format and even against some decks in BLW-On. The Fighting Weakness did hurt here, on the other hand, since Terrakion, Donphan, and Landorus EX were all pretty good at taking advantage of it. The Psychic Resistance could occasionally make life easier against Mewtwo EX depending on exact Energy counts. Shiftry also had that Retreat Cost at just 1, so that could be nice if you needed to do so.

If you were using Shiftry, it was for Giant Fan. When you played Shiftry from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you flipped a coin. If heads, you got to choose 1 of your opponent’s Pokemon and have your opponent shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck. This was hard to rely on due to the coin flip, and, in the HGSS-On and BLW-On standard formats, at least, wasn’t too effective.

The Expanded format was different. Shiftry had an amazing opportunity to get multiple attempts at this per turn with a combination of Forest of Giant Plants, a Nuzleaf card that was actually a Grass-type that could work with the Stadium card, and Devolution Spray. The goal here was to blow away all of the opponent’s Pokemon before they got a turn. It was all about luck and you’d usually either end the game on the first turn or get completely run over. This made for awful games and, in 2015, Shiftry was banned from the Expanded Format. In 2017, Shiftry was unbanned, but Forest of Giant Plants was then banned instead. Either way, the deck was really unhealthy and getting rid of it was probably a good thing.

Whirlwind was an attack that did 60 damage for 2 Darkness and a Colorless Energy and forced your opponent to switch their Active Pokemon with a Benched Pokemon of their choosing. It could be annoying at the right time, but the opponent had too much say in what happened here and the damage wasn’t great.

Shiftry was pretty weak in standard formats since it was luck-based and didn’t get a ton of chances to do what it wanted to in a turn. It had time where it got several chances to work in Expanded, and that was just a mess and ended up in a ban. I’m not sure whether that makes Shiftry incredible or kind of weak. It was honestly both.

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Bunelunny Buneary, Bunnelby and Scorbunny fusion Normal/Fire Type Ability: Gooey The Chocolate Bunny Pokemon Bunelunny is...
caption:
Bunelunny

Buneary, Bunnelby and Scorbunny fusion

Normal/Fire Type

Ability: Gooey

The Chocolate Bunny Pokemon

Bunelunny is usually found around Easter time.  Its favourite food is chocolate and it even smells of chocolate.  Its digging skills are admired as it uses its ears and hands to dig.  It has been known to help with the chocolate making process as it heats up chocolate to help put it into moulds.

As it is Easter, I thought that it’d be a good idea to fuse the bunny pokemon together.  Of course, if you don’t celebrate Easter, have a good day, whatever you celebrate or don’t celebrate.
